headline: How To Make Classic Chicken Alfredo Pasta: The Easiest, Cheesiest Method
description: Learn the basics of Alfredo sauce and how to use it for making chicken fettuccini Alfredo any night of the week.
recipeIngredient: 2  boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1 pound total)
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided
8 tablespoons (1 stick) European-style unsalted butter, divided
1 cup finely grated Parmesan cheese (2 1/2 ounces), plus more for serving
Coarsely chopped fresh parsley leaves, for serving

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Cook the pasta, drain, and reserve cooking water. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes. Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Dry the chicken and season with salt and pepper. Meanwhile, pat both sides of the chicken breasts dry with paper towels. Season with 3/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil over medium-high in a large frying pan. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat until shimmering, 2 to 3 minutes. If you have a pan that has straight sides, here's the time to use it. Do not use a nonstick pan.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken to the hot pan, and cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Swirl the pan just before adding the chicken to distribute the oil. Add the chicken and leave it alone for 5 to 7 minutes, until the bottom is golden-brown. If you try to to turn the chicken and it feels stuck, it isn't ready to flip.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: Flip the chicken and cook for another 5 to 7 minutes, until the chicken reaches 165°F. Flip the chicken over and add 1 tablespoon of the butter right between them. Pick up the pan and give it a gentle swirl to distribute the melting butter. Cook the chicken until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F, 5 to 7 minutes more.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
recipeInstructions.text: Slice the chicken and cover to keep warm. Transfer the chicken to a plate or clean cutting board and let rest for 3 minutes. Cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Cover with aluminum foil while you prepare the rest of the dish.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
recipeInstructions.text: Melt the rest of the butter and sauté the garlic. Add the remaining 7 tablespoons butter to the same pan used for the chicken and place over medium heat until melted. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
recipeInstructions.text: Make the Alfredo sauce. Whisk in the cream, Parmesan, nutmeg, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes. If the sauce is too thick, add some of the reserved pasta cooking water, a few tablespoons at a time, to thin it out.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
recipeInstructions.text: Add the drained pasta and toss to coat in the sauce. Add the drained fettuccine to the sauce and toss to coat. Divide the pasta among serving bowls and top with a few slices of chicken. Garnish with parsley, more Parmesan, and black pepper if desired.

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days. Reheat gently on the stovetop or in the microwave; the sauce may separate.Make ahead: This dish is best served immediately, although the chicken can be cooked 1 day in advance and added to the sauce with the cream until warmed through.

review.reviewBody: YUM. So simple. I really liked the touch of nutmeg that creates a really rich, warm flavor. I might try some garlic next time too, but it was really delicious, and holds up great for leftovers.
I recently made this recipe for a pasta bar that I had with friends and family. It was a HUGE hit! So creamy and delicious.
I know you're supposed to use European butter, but I've used regular butter and it's still super delicious.
so rich and creamy! Great for a little more special dinner

name: How To Make Classic Chicken Alfredo Pasta: The Easiest, Cheesiest Method

author.name: Meghan Splawn
author.description: Meghan was the Food Editor for Kitchn's Skills content. She's a master of everyday baking, family cooking, and harnessing good light. Meghan approaches food with an eye towards budgeting — both time and money — and having fun. Meghan has a baking and pastry degree, and spent the first 10 years of her career as part of Alton Brown's culinary team. She co-hosts a weekly podcast about food and family called Didn't I Just Feed You.

abstract: Tips For Making Classic Chicken Alfredo Pasta Use European-style butter as it has slightly higher fat content. Use a large frying pan to cook chicken breast instead of a nonstick pan. Cook the chicken until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F. Add a few tablespoons of reserved pasta cooking water if the sauce is too thick.
